artist: Engraver: Jacob Matham; Artist: after Hendrick Goltzius
description: old bearded man wearing a long fur-trimmed coat and pointed cap, holding a small flaming kettle; symbols for Pisces, Aquarius and Capricorn in sky; face blowing snowy wind at left; round image
inscription:
above and to left of figure\'s head, in the image: [Hyems.]; below figure\'s feet, in the image: [HG Inuet.]
inscribed in plate around circumference: [Alget et ante focum torpescit Bruma niualis. Pellita cingens frigida membra toga. Anni babentis senium capricorne redicus. Te radiante stupet terra sepulta riue.]
provenance: Private collection, United States; (Childs Gallery, Boston); acquired by MIA, 2007
title: Allegory of Winter
